properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 10 at 6:48PM CST until January 10 at 7:15PM CST by NWS St Louis MO
properties.description:
At 647 PM CST, severe thunderstorms capable of producing tornadoes
were located along a line extending from 8 miles west of Davis to
near Hawk Point to near Wright City to near Innsbrook, moving east at
50 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage
to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree damage is
likely.

These dangerous storms will be near...
Davis around 655 PM CST.
Wentzville and Troy around 700 PM CST.
Lake St. Louis, Moscow Mills, Eolia, Josephville, Fountain N'
Lakes and Chain of Rocks around 705 PM CST.
O'Fallon, Dardenne Prairie and St. Paul around 710 PM CST.
St. Peters, Elsberry and Winfield around 715 PM CST.

Other locations impacted by these tornadic storms include Nebo,
Whiteside, Brussels, Mozier, Batchtown, Meppen, Olney, Hamburg, Silex
and Flint Hill.

This also includes Cuivre River State Park.

This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 188 and 219.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest
floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a
mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter
and protect yourself from flying debris.

NWSheadline: A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CST FOR CALHOUN COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS...SOUTHEASTERN PIKE COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL ILLINOIS...NORTHWESTERN ST. CHARLES...LINCOLN...EASTERN WARREN COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI AND SOUTHEASTERN PIKE COUNTIES IN NORTHEASTERN MISSOURI
